title: Sniped by BOOSTER

embed.description: We analyze millions of LoL games every day to get champion stats, matchups, builds & summoner rankings. Champions stats, popularity, winrate, best items and spells. Teams rankings.

body:
Hey guys,

just had a ranked game (EUW), getting stomped on by some booster and his friends, getting their elo right before the end of the season.
Things went south during the game, I played Illaoi top. Their top pick was Singed; after 10 minutes I was 0/4, after 20 minutes the game was over. I wasn't feeding, I died under the turret. Singed had 200+ farm after 20 minutes, he snowballed all lanes, even our botlane that had been winning against them (they had a lucian adc that had 27 farm after 20 minutes).

Singed mentioned in all chat that he would gladly boost me to gold (giving a price). And all the while I was flamed for being such a bad player. Here's a link http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/euw/anrisas showing the history of games played by Singed who was boosting his entire team. (And here a link of his team member lucian, that has a very interesting variation in skill: how can he have 27 and in the previous 300+ farm? http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/euw/snNob4Style). Another members (lee sin) of their team had been writing in all chat as well, they probably knew each other.

My question is, how do I report this to RIOT in a way they will definitely KNOW? I mean, after the game the ezrael who had been winning against that boosted lucian was mad at me, for "losing the game", getting ME reported. So unless I can write a ticket that will be read it seems people like that will get away with it. I submitted a request on the official website https://support.riotgames.com, detailing the game, but I don't think that is what "request" about gameplay should be about.

Where do I go/ask?

greetings,
NIHILIR

replies.body: At first, you're in the german forum. Write a ticket to the support and report these people after the match.
